newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Golf-Alker equals course record to win Sth Australian Open.
newsitem.headline: Golf-Alker equals course record to win Sth Australian Open.

text.p: New Zealander Steve Alker equalled the Kooyonga Golf Club course record on Sunday to win the South Australian Open after Australia's Wayne Grady made a hash of the 17th.
Alker fired a seven-under-par 65 to leapfrog the early leaders, including British Open champion Tom Lehman, and win by one shot from Grady. He finished on 273, 15 under par.
British Open champion Lehman, who led by one shot overnight, carded a 72 to share third place on 13 under with Craig Parry and Brett Ogle of Australia and New Zealand's Michael Long.
